[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Function: prune_event_accumulator()] [Position iteration] Does iterating Position::from_inorder_index(0) guarantee all positions for a version are found, or can some positions be skipped? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Function: prune_event_accumulator()] [Merkle tree integrity] After pruning accumulator entries, can the remaining Merkle tree become invalid or unable to generate proofs for remaining events? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Function: prune_event_accumulator()] [Error propagation] If delete operations fail partway through, does the function properly rollback or can it leave the database in an inconsistent state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Function: prune_event_accumulator()] [Schema mismatch] Does this function also prune corresponding EventSchema entries, or can orphaned events remain after accumulator pruning? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Function: prune_event_accumulator()] [Iterator seek] The seek to (begin, Position::from_inorder_index(0)) - can begin being 0 or u64::MAX cause unexpected iterator behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Struct: EventHashReader] [Lifetime safety] Does the 'a lifetime properly enforce that EventHashReader cannot outlive the EventStore reference, preventing use-after-free? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Function: EventHashReader::new()] [Version validation] Is the version parameter validated to be within committed range, or can future/invalid versions be used to create EventHashReader instances? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Function: EventHashReader::get()] [Position validation] Does the get function validate that Position is within valid Merkle tree bounds for the version, or can invalid positions access unintended hash values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Function: EventHashReader::get()] [Hash collision] If the database returns a HashValue that collides with another valid hash, can this break Merkle proof verification or consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Function: EventHashReader::get()] [Database miss] When EventAccumulatorSchema lookup returns None, the error format exposes the Position - can this leak information about internal Merkle tree structure? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Function: EventHashReader::get()] [Concurrent pruning] Can pruning delete hash values while EventHashReader is being used, causing inconsistent Merkle tree reads? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Struct: EmptyReader] [Unreachable safety] The comment says 'Asserts get() is never called' using unreachable!(), but can this panic be triggered by incorrect HashReader interface usage? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Struct: EmptyReader] [Interface contract] Does EmptyReader properly implement the HashReader trait contract, or can calling code incorrectly invoke get() causing panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Struct: EventStore] [Database handle safety] The Arc<DB> is shared - are all database operations properly synchronized, or can concurrent modifications cause data races? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Struct: EventStore] [Schema consistency] Does EventStore guarantee that EventSchema, EventByKeySchema, EventByVersionSchema, and EventAccumulatorSchema remain synchronized? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Multiple schemas] [Cross-schema integrity] If EventByKeySchema has an entry but EventSchema doesn't (or vice versa), can this cause permanent event lookup failures or state inconsistency? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Multiple schemas] [Index desynchronization] Can EventByVersionSchema and EventByKeySchema become desynchronized where the same event has different indices in different schemas? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [EventStore construction] [Database validation] Does EventStore::new() validate that the provided Arc<DB> contains valid schema definitions and proper column families? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Database operations] [Transaction safety] Are all read operations guaranteed to see a consistent snapshot, or can partial writes from concurrent transactions be observed? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Error handling] [Panic vs Result] Do all database errors properly propagate through Result types, or can unexpected database states cause panics that crash validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Schema access] [Column family isolation] Does the EventStore properly isolate access to its column families, or can other components corrupt event data through shared DB access? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Event emission] [Sequence number coordination] How does EventStore coordinate with the VM during event emission to ensure sequence numbers are assigned correctly without gaps or duplicates? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Event emission] [Atomic transaction] If a transaction fails to commit, are all events emitted by that transaction properly rolled back from all schemas? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Event queries] [Consistency with state] Can events be queried that correspond to state versions that failed consensus or were rolled back? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/event_store/mod.rs] [Event pruning] [State root validity] After pruning events, do state roots that reference pruned events remain valid, or can this break historical state verification? (Critical)
